job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The only Pros of working for FIDM is the flexibility. You can come in late and leave early; take long lunches and go shopping. You will not be reprimanded for these actions. This is the only good thing about working here.
cons: There is no room for growth. When positions become available, they are not advertised to employees for promotional opportunities. They will hire a family member of an employee or a referral from an employee. You will NEVER get a raise, and if you do they will just take it right back with a "company wide" pay cut that is 3-5% more than the raise, so you end up making less than before you got the raise. Working in this department will decrease your marketability in the working world tremendously. There are too many employees for the amount of work. For this to be a college with design programs, they should be more advanced in technology. No one is held accountable for their actions. Supervisors lack the ability to manage a team effectively. The people in management positions have no managerial skills. Supervisors don't encourage you, nor do you get recognition for anything you accomplish. If you come up with an idea, keep it to yourself, they will tell you your idea isn't good then let six months go by and take your idea as if they were the ones that came up with it in the first place. If you are of a certain Demographic you will be successful. They hire people at different rates for the same positions that don't require a certain educational background. (i.e. $12/hr vs. $16/hr). The office is unprofessional, and their practices are unethical.
